reviews.text: This hotel has the most important - great location in the old town. This makes it easy to walk around to any of the sights worth seeing. So if you can handle a mediocre breakfast, bedroom and interiordeco, you'll be happy with this hotel. It's all OK and they even have a pet bird in the reception....!
reviews.title: Central, but it stops there.

reviews.text: I have just returned from Riga. Myself and 2 girlfriends travelled for the Christmas markets. We flew with Wizz air from Luton - easy straightforward flight. I would reccommend using Baltic taxis from the airport which are 12 lats - we took a normal taxi that was 19 - lesson learned!
reviews.title: Girlie Christmas Markets trip to Riga

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We checked into the Hotel Konventa Seta which is in the heart of the old down. Perfect location, everything is walkable. We stayed in a suite for 3 adults. Very comfortable and spacious. The room was cold but the hotel immediately put in a portable heater. Staff were very friendly and breakfast was very good with a good selection.
reviews.title: Good Hotel, Excellent Location

reviews.text: I would highly recommend the hotel and the area.
reviews.title: Nice Riga Hotel

reviews.text: Stayed here for 3 nights from 25 November 2011. Hotel is in an excellent location just a few meters from the main street in the old town. Room decor is a little dated but the staff and maid service are excellent. Breakfast is good and has a good range of hot and cold food (although a little bizarre for the typical English palate! Overall, highly recommended for a short stay in the lovely Baltic city.
reviews.title: Location, location, location!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel once we found it was in an excellent central location with lovely craft stalls outside and through a delightful archway into a courtyard just behind the cathedral.
reviews.title: It's all about location...

reviews.text: Our lovely room just lacked a fridge and air-con (but in July even though it was warm you did not really need it). It had lovely old beams above the bed and a television with a good choice of TV English stations. Our room was in the roof on the 3rd floor. We were able to open the roof light windows and there were blinds on these.
reviews.title: Excellent location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There is a nice lounge area downstairs in the lobby and a free safety deposit box. There is also internet which costs 1 lat.
reviews.title: Great location! Great hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast is served in the next door hotel in a pleasant room or you can eat outside. This courtyard entrance is locked in the evenings.
reviews.title: Great location,Value for money

reviews.text: Be warned that it is expensive in Riga, but we were lucky enough to find a deal printed on the menu of a chain of lovely café bars called “Double Coffee” which were all over Riga, selling 2 pints of decent local larger for 1.69 lats (a real bargain) and very reasonably priced nice coffee and meals – especially the lovely omelettes.
reviews.title: “Riga Old town hidden gem.”
early bookings at Konventa Seta - end up Hotel de Rome
reviews.text: booked last October for Konventa Seta - arrived 10.30pm very tired -to find that there were no rooms available for us.

However, we were transferred - at the same price to the sister hotel the Hotel De Rome. Which was fab - nice clean rooms, great breakfasts, sauna and the staff were lovely. Would recommend early booked as it seemed that the Konventa Seta gets filled - and they transfer early bookings across to the Hotel De Rome which doesn't get so full.
reviews.title: Konventa Seta Hotel and old Riga

reviews.text: Just back from a brilliant weekend in Riga. Location of the hotel is unbeatable. Within seconds of just about everything. The rooms are tucked away in a quiet yard so did not experience any noise even tho youare in the heart of the old city. Room was clean, good and comfortable bed and pillows, good bathroom and powerful hot shower and friendly helpful staff. Would definately stay here again.
reviews.title: Quiet, clean and central

reviews.text: As for Riga, do visit the occupation museaum. Like a previous reviewer I recommend De Lacys irish Bar (turn left out of the hotel)- great food and great atmosphere.
reviews.title: Reasonably Priced and very central hotel

reviews.text: restaurants and bars are pletiful in the old town and the Latvians much more interesting and friendly than I was led to believe they would be. English widely spoken by the young Latvians.
reviews.title: Location, Cleanliness, Security, Comfort, Friendliness - 5 stars

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is an excellent hotel. We thoroughly enjoyed every moment of our stay at the Konventa Seta. Our room was very large, spacious and extremely clean. The bathroom was large and modern, with a bath and shower.
reviews.title: Exceptional hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Everything was extremely clean, towels and sheets etc and the maid service was very good.
reviews.title: good value, great location

reviews.text: The hotel is located right in the center of Old Riga, which is great for exploring the sights. It is in a good location for Restaurants and shopping too, with a modern shopping center just around the corner.
reviews.title: Great Hotel.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel bar has just been renovated, It is comfortable and relaxing with a modern twist.
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.text: This really is a beautiful hotel, and we will be going back without a doubt!
reviews.title: Central location, professional, easy to find

reviews.text: Well, it's very historic on the outside but the rooms are disappointing, sparsely furnished and poorly lit. The reastaurant is like a motorway service station. Handy for the centre of Riga and not hugely expensive, just not what it could be.
reviews.title: OK but overrated

reviews.text: Just returned from Riga and three nights at Konventa Seta,, being two couples we had booked two juinior suites (worth the extra) on arrival we were met with friendly staff the rooms were together ( in block 5) far end of hotel which was very quiet, the hotel is very clean, good breakfast and convinient for everthing Riga has to offer. We are already planning to go back next year!! we ejoyed it so much.
reviews.title: Wonderful Riga

reviews.text: We stayed in Konventa Seta with friends for two nights. The location of the hotel is excellent, right in the middle of the old town. We arrived late in the evening and because the hotel was overbooked we got upgraded to suites (at first they wanted to move us to the 5 star sister hotel "de Rome", but changed their mind after a while). The suites were very clean and cosy but not luxorious. There was also a small kitchen corner in both of them, but funnily no kitchen utensils at all (not even glasses!). At night there was some noise from outside which didn´t bother us but it disturbed our friends (we had a room in the 2nd and our friends in the 5th floor). But I think it is not easy to find an absolutely quiet hotel in Rigas old town. The breakfast was nothing special, but ok. The staff at the reception was very friendly and helpful and spoke good english.
reviews.title: ok hotel
Beautiful Riga
reviews.text: This was my second time in Riga. The first time I stayed in hotel Bergs which is GREAT but also pretty expensive and not in the old town. I think Konventa Seta is a very good choice if you want to stay in the old town and not to pay too much (we payed 95e/room/night through Booking.com).

We had a fantastic time in Riga. The location of this hotel cannot be beaten as it is right in the heart of the old town just about five minutes away from every highlight you want to visit. The hotel is about 10 minutes away from the number 22 bus-stop from the airport (get-off just after you cross the river). We had two apartments on the second floor facing the internal courtyard and the facilities were modern, comfortable, and cleaned by the maid on a daily basis. The breakfast was very good with a wide selection to suit every possible taste. The dining room was busy first thing but after 9am you could always find somewhere to sit. Given the central location the back-ground noise was acceptable but we would advise closing your windows at night time to avoid the late night revellers. We suggest you pick up a guide to the restaurants from reception as its difficult to find the best by just walking round the city. The prices are comparable to London but you can find a pretty good menu for around 20 Lats a head. We recommend visting the art nouveau area (Alison loved it!) as the buildings were spectacular. All in all Riga is a charming city with lots to see and do but without the hustle and bustle of other large European cities.
reviews.title: Disappointed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Konventa Seta between the 25th to 30th September 2011. I thought the place was absolutely perfectly set, in the old town of Riga, with a restaurant on site, it's own beer garden, and a lovely room to top it all off. Cable TV, with channels in at least 4 languages, a removeable shower head, and plenty of space. Very helpful chambermaids. Only problems we encountered was that the hot water only seemd to work between 07:30 and 10:00 each morning, and asking about it at reception got a lot of smiles and "Should be OK now" but it never worked after 10:30 to my knowledge... One particular member of staff could be a bit iffy sometimes, as if he wasn't impressed at having to do his job, but apart from that isolated waiter and the water issue, which were easily worked round, then the hotel is the perfect base to explore the beautiful old town of Riga, and use the Kiwi Bar as your "last drink" stop on the way home...
reviews.title: A Very Nice Stay, with reservations....

reviews.text: I would not hesitate to recommend it to friends...
reviews.title: excellent location

reviews.text: excellent location,poor room(and cold) but the hotel owns 3 restaurants inside the building.Breakfast buffet but very,very poor in quality and quantity.Very silents rooms,no wifi in rooms,small TV but big junior suite.I slept in a narrow twin bed.
reviews.title: Perfect if your wanting to be based in the old town

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A refurbed ex convent, the hotel is based a 2 minute walk from the kiwi bar and 5 minutes if your out late as the lane is closed once dark.
reviews.title: Convenient location, inexpensive, it's decent hotel!

reviews.text: Freinds commented on how handy it was for everything in the old town and I agree.
reviews.title: Probably the best location in Riga!

reviews.text: This hotel is all about LOCATION. A couple of steps away from Kalku Iela (main street in the Old Town), Livu Square, Centrs Shopping Center, etc.. The rooms are ok, quite big and equipped according to 3-star standards.
reviews.title: Great location, but NOISY!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: BUT AT NIGHT BEWARE: Avoid the rooms towards the alley way outside the Hotel. First of all there is a Disco accross the alley that will keep you up all night with a monotone thumping sound, which you can hear AND feel as well. Plus there is yelling, screaming, swearing, crying, glass breaking and virtually any other kind of noise you can imagine outside the window ALL NIGHT. This is a huge problem in summer when the windows have to stay open due to the lack of air-conditioning. We hardly slept two winks during our 2 night stay from the 19th to the 21st of July.
reviews.title: Great Location, Big Room

reviews.text: Staff is indifferent, same as you will find in most Latvian Hotels. But things are improving slowly, at least in Riga.
reviews.title: Don't expect too much!

likes.disliked: — Lack of facilities i.e Bar & Restaurant

reviews.text: Would I stay there again? Probably yes BUT NOT in a room towards the street/alley way
reviews.title: Nice Hotel, good location

likes.disliked: — Strange furniture and spartan fittings in rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is a collection of buidlings around some courtyards and small walking streets. Very Charming. Our room was very spacious with comfortable beds. Very good breakfast included. Right in the center of Riga. Make sure you get a room on an interior courtyard. Rooms on the outside face a very loud all night disco. Friendly and helpful front desk staff.
reviews.title: Good hotel, in Great locaction.

likes.liked: — location in middle of old town
likes.disliked: — Dim lighting added style, but made reading hard!

reviews.title: What a Great Location!!
reviews.text: Just back after spending a great weekend in Riga. The Location of this hotel has to be seen to be believed...literally 10 seconds from the centre of the old town. We had a large, relatively plain room on the ground floor, had no noise interuptions and found the hotel staff very friendly. Lots to see in Riga, although I would recommend DeLacys Irish Bar (located about 60 secs from the hotel)for the food and a bit of craic or the Candle Bar(located about 20 seconds away) for the romantics out there. Get to Riga quick though, as it is endanger of being overrun by loud groups of Englishmen.

This hotel had charm and a brilliant location in the centre of the Old Town. We were happy with our room on the second floor of the main building, although the beds were rather hard. However, it was warm and cosy. However, noisy groups checking in from the Ryanair flights on Friday afternoon gave us warning of the anti-social effect of low cost flights, which appeared to disgorge huge numbers of mostly Essex males into Riga for the weekend. The night got lively about 3.30, when they all fell out of the clubs and decided to wake up the hotel. One, hammering on our room door at that time received a hostile reception. Similar on Saturday night, with out the knocking on the door. Managment are obviously used to this problem, and simply commented that it was Friday night. Groups of young British men were an embarrassment in the town too, to the extent that I pretended not to speak English. The staff in the shops were obviously expecting shoplifting. However, all that apart, Riga was a fantastic city to visit, with wonderful buildings and streets to explore. If the Latvians seem a bit dour, you only have to visit the Museum of Occupation to understand why. Go and see it now before it becomes too westernised!
reviews.title: Good hotel but avoid Fridays and Saturdays

reviews.text: This hotel, in an excellent position in the heart of the old city, is a minute away from a square, which in January had an outdoor ice rink and a small selection of craft stalls. Although set in an old convent, the hotel was modern and comfortable. We sometimes ate in the hotel restaurant where both the food and the service were excellent. There were numerous other restaurants, cafes, bars and coffee shops in the immediate vacinity, which were cheaper but also served excellent food. The whole of the old town is within a short walking distance of the hotel. Go up the lift to the top of St. Peter’s church (next to the hotel) to get a birds eye view of the old city. Don’t miss the massive market in the old Zeppelin hangers but beware of possible pickpockets in this area. The bronze statue of the “Musicians of Bremen” at the back of the hotel complex, to the side of St. Peter’s church should be touched for good luck. There are a huge number of shops selling amber but be careful you are not buying plastic imitations!
reviews.title: Great Hotel in the heart of the old city

reviews.text: I agree with all the positive comments made by other reviews, good value for money also. For those planning on partying in Riga though, I would say find somewhere cheaper as you will be spending very little time in your room. Forums hotel may be a better value option.
reviews.title: Good hotel but consider others if a party animal!
Dont underestimate the cold
reviews.text: SITUATION Excellent, Centre of old town where all shops restaraunts and most of must see tourist attractions are. Hotel is surrounded by large wall so no noise from the outside. Central market and station 5 to 10 minutes walk. Trams and buses 20sentimes (20p)fare nearbye.
